example[0]: His principal reason for making the journey was to visit his family.
example[1]: Teaching is her principal source of income.
example[2]: the principal character in the book
definition[1]: someone who is in charge of a school
example[3]: a small school with just three teachers and the principal
definition[2]: someone who is in charge of a university or college
definition[3]: the main person in a business or organization, who can make important business decisions and is legally responsible for them
example[4]: The principal of the business has an office in New York.
definition[4]: the main performer in a play or in a group of musicians, dancers etc
example[5]: She later became a principal with the Royal Ballet.
definition[5]: the original amount of money that is lent to someone, not including any of the interest
definition[6]: the original amount of a loan, not including any of the interest that is paid
example[6]: The loan amounts outstanding totaled about $32.2 million in principal and $2.2 million in interest.
example[7]: No principal is due for repayment until next year.
definition[7]: an important person, manager etc in some types of organization, who may be legally responsible for its actions
example[8]: Mr O'Brien is a principal of the Law and Economics Consulting Group.
definition[8]: the actual buyer and the seller in a business deal, rather than the people who represent them, or BROKERs who buy and sell for them
example[9]: None of the principals would comment on the purchase price.
example[10]: Portland is one of the principal unloading points for Japanese automobiles.
example[11]: Gulf’s strategy of concentrating on its principal business of oil and gas production
example[12]: As principal shareholders in the company, no one has a greater interest in its management.
example[13]: Baxter Healthcare is the principal subsidiary of Baxter International Inc.  (=the largest company owned by them).
example[14]: Teaching is her primary source of income.
definition[9]: relating to the original amount of a loan, rather than any interest
example[16]: The total principal amount of debentures being sold was increased to $75 million.
example[17]: A new government may be unwilling to repay interest on the principal sum loaned.
